meanings.definition: To make a harsh, grating sound
meanings.sent1: The old door rasped loudly when it opened.
meanings.sent2: She rasped the metal against the stone to sharpen it.
meanings.sent3: The rusty gate rasped like a tired old man trying to sing.
meanings.sent4: His voice rasped with anger, cutting through the silence.
meanings.sent5: The saw rasped against the wood, creating a rough edge.

meanings.definition: To scrape or rub with a rough, abrasive tool
meanings.sent1: He rasped the rough sandpaper against the wood.
meanings.sent2: The gardener rasped the rust off the metal fence.
meanings.sent3: The cat rasped its claws against the scratching post.
meanings.sent4: The wind rasped the sand against the window, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: She rasped the knife against the stone to sharpen it.

meanings.definition: A harsh, grating noise or sound
meanings.sent1: The rasped of the chains echoed through the dungeon.
meanings.sent2: The rasped of the old engine filled the garage.
meanings.sent3: The rasped of the chalk on the board made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent4: The rasped of the metal gate opening signaled their arrival.
meanings.sent5: The rasped of the violin strings added a haunting quality to the music.
